qas.question: What is the usual way to make a plural?
What can the addition of the suffix -s produce?
To what are these morphological changes similar?
What is an important plural alternation?

context: As in the other Western Romance languages, the main plural expression is the <a0_0>suffix -s<a0_0/>, which may create <a1_0>morphological alternations<a1_0/> similar to the ones found in <a2_0>gender inflection<a2_0/>, albeit more rarely. The most important one is the <a3_0>addition of -o-<a3_0/> before certain consonant groups, a phonetic phenomenon that does not affect feminine forms: el pols/els polsos ("the pulse"/"the pulses") vs. la pols/les pols ("the dust"/"the dusts").
